title: (x) Car number plate - Licenz Plate {Mike F}
content:
Does anyone know where I can find this, or a type like it?   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312105143im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/33688.gif)   
   
Thanks

 [‹ Titleist logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312105143/http:/www.typophile.com/node/4334 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Location of "infinity" symbol {Chesh, Richard} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312105143/http:/www.typophile.com/node/4322 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jonathanlawley

comments.content: Font Bureau has [Pennsylvania](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312105143/http:/www.philsfonts.com/showing.html?sku=FB000119X1P2&start=1) and T-26 has [Keystone State](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312105143/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/keystone-state/). I think they are both fairly similar to your sample.

where can i buy Lineto Alpha Headline ? Its not for sale on lineto.com?   
   
Thank you
You can't... Lineto licensed it exclusively to one particular company, so it's not available to the public anymore (at least not for a few years).

An exact match appears to be Levi's [Licenz Plate](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312105143/http:/www.geocities.com/noimage_2001/fonts1.html) (using the uc I for a 1):   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312105143im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/33720.gif)

It appears to be the approved UK number plate font. It is called Charles Wright and should be [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312105143/http:/www.charles-wright.com/) but the site seems to be down.   
   
Official information [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312105143/http:/www.dvla.gov.uk/vehicles/regmarks/reg_marks_current_requirements.htm#mandatorycharacterfont) and [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312105143/http:/www.hmso.gov.uk/si/si2001/20010561.htm#sch4)
